summary: The Hundred Years' War was a long fight between England and France, lasting from 1337 to 1453. It started because King Edward III of England wanted to be king of France too. The war had three main parts and involved lots of different countries. In the end, France kept its kingdom, and both countries became stronger and more independent. This war changed how battles were fought in Europe, with new weapons and armies.
title: Hundred Years' War
